page.title: 03OLD BUILDINGS IN BARFORD
page.content: The oldest house in the village is C15 and is built of Chilmark stone. Many of the older buildings date to the C17 or C18 and many are listed buildings of historical interest. The Green Dragon public house is a late C18 rebuilding of an older house. It was once called the Dragon Inn and possibly The Blue Dragon. It once had its own brewery. There was once a forge, a corn mill and a bakery in the village. They have all been converted to dwellings. A row of old farmworkers' cottages near the church, in Duck Lane have been demolished and large modern houses built in their place. A row of cottages near the junction with the main road was demolished for road improvements. It is thought that there was a silk or woollen factory in Factory Lane.
